attributes.action: Ensure venue owners/landlords are not profiteering from the Covid-19 crisis
attributes.additional_details:
On talkRADIO 07/01/2021, G-A-Y nightclub owner Jermey Joseph said the he has paid £1 million in rent since March with zero income to his landlords who have refused to offer him any rent relief during the current crisis. 

https://www.facebook.com/talkRADIOUK/videos/689947508345422

Across the UK thousands of venues are in the same position - we would like the Government to ensure that landlords/property owners are not profiteering from public funds at the expense of the hospitality sector.
attributes.background: The hospitality sector needs support to survive. We want the Government to look at venues under threat because their owners refuse to negotiate/pass on any rent relief to those who lease their buildings. No landlord should benefit from public finances during the crisis whilst their tenants suffer.

rejection.details: The UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for private rental contracts between landlords and tenants. You could start a new petition calling for the Government to offer support to landlords if they reduce rent for tenants, if that's something that you'd like to happen.
